annotation.spannedText: Measles can be prevented with vaccination

classMention.mentionClass: Measles can be prevented with vaccination

annotation.spannedText: Children should receive two doses of MMR

classMention.mentionClass: Children should receive two doses of MMR

annotation.spannedText: MMR vaccine is very safe and effective

classMention.mentionClass: MMR vaccine is very safe and effective

annotation.spannedText: MMR vaccine is the best way to protect children against measles and to prevent them from spreading the disease to others

classMention.mentionClass: MMR vaccine is the best way to protect children against measles and to prevent them from spreading the disease to others

annotation.spannedText: They should get at least one dose of the MMR vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: They should get at least one dose of the MMR vaccine

annotation.spannedText: If you do not have written documentation of measles immunity, you should get MMR vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: If you do not have written documentation of measles immunity, you should get MMR vaccine

annotation.spannedText: If you are not sure if you are protected against measles, first try to find your vaccination records or documentation of measles immunity

classMention.mentionClass: If you are not sure if you are protected against measles, first try to find your vaccination records or documentation of measles immunity

annotation.spannedText: There is no harm in getting another dose of MMR vaccine if you may already be immune to measles

classMention.mentionClass: There is no harm in getting another dose of MMR vaccine if you may already be immune to measles

annotation.spannedText: If they need to get vaccinated for measles, they should avoid becoming pregnant until one month (28 days) after receiving the MMR vaccine. Pregnant women who are not protected against measles should wait until after they have given birth to get MMR vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: If they need to get vaccinated for measles, they should avoid becoming pregnant until one month (28 days) after receiving the MMR vaccine. Pregnant women who are not protected against measles should wait until after they have given birth to get MMR vaccine

annotation.spannedText: The majority of people who get measles in the United States are unvaccinated

classMention.mentionClass: The majority of people who get measles in the United States are unvaccinated

annotation.spannedText: Measles can spread when it reaches a community in the United States where groups of people are unvaccinated

classMention.mentionClass: Measles can spread when it reaches a community in the United States where groups of people are unvaccinated
